document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Deltocephalus group of leafhoppers (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae) in China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Deltocephalus group of leafhoppers (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae) in China

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Forewing with dark zig-zag marking (Plate I: H).....................................................
M . dorsalis

2 . Subgenital plate without macrosetae (
Fig. 11
A).......................................................
M . glabra

3 . Pygofer lobe with truncated hind margin (
Fig. 30
A)........................................
M . dinghuensis
sp. nov.

7 . Subgenital plate with apex broadly rounded (
Fig. 29
D)..........................................
M . webbi
sp. nov.

- Subgenital plate with apex narrowly rounded (
Fig. 27
B)..............................................
M . bilineata

8 . Apex of aedeagal shaft with ventral triangular membranous area in lateral view (
Fig. 19
F)...........
M . pileiformis
sp. nov.
- Apex of aedeagal shaft without triangular membranous area in lateral view........................................ 9

9 . Aedeagal shaft with ventral margin extending beyond gonopore process-like (
Fig. 8
C)....................
M . schmidtgeni

- Aedeagal shaft with ventral margin not extending beyond gonopore process-like (
Fig. 12
F)....................
M . oryzae

10 . Style apophysis very slender, with an acutely pointed apex (
Figs 16
C, 17 C)...................................... 11

11 . Subgenital plate long, outer margin slightly concave (
Fig. 16
B)......................................
M . samuelsoni

- Subgenital plate short, outer margin slightly convex (
Fig. 17
B).......................................
M . subviridis

13 . Aedeagal shaft subapical ventral margin serrate (
Fig. 23
E)........................................
M . crura
sp. nov.

- Aedeagal shaft subapical ventral margin smooth (
Fig. 24
D)..................................
M . rostriformis
sp. nov.

- Subgenital plate short and broad (
Fig. 9
A).........................................................
M . distincta

16 . Aedeagal shaft subapical ventral margin serrate (
Fig. 25
E).....................................
M . scalpella
sp. nov.

17 . Aedeagal shaft widest at midlength (
Fig. 34
L)......................................................
M . maculata

19 . Connective distinctively longer than aedeagus (
Fig. 20
D).......................................
M . cultella
sp. nov.

- Connective nearly equal in length to aedeagus (
Fig. 15
F)........................................
M . xanthocephala
.

20 . Style apophysis short (
Fig. 26
C); apex of aedeagal shaft hooked apically in lateral view (
Fig. 26
E).........
M . irisa
sp. nov.
- Style apophysis moderately long; aedeagal shaft not hooked apically in lateral view................................ 21

21 . Forewing with brown spot on clavus (Plate II: B)..............................................
M . obongsanensis

22 . Connective distinctively longer than aedeagus (
Fig. 22
D)...................................
M . pararemigia
sp. nov.

23 . Subgenital plate lateral margin distinctly convex (
Fig. 18
B).............................................
M. tareni

25 . Vertex slightly longer medially than next to eye and slightly shorter than length of pronotum (Plate II: D).......
M . latifrons

- Vertex distinctly longer medially than next to eye and slightly shorter than length of pronotum (Plate II: E).....................................................................................................
M . heuksandoensis

26 . Style apophysis not swollen in middle (
Figs 31
D, 31 E)...............................................
